Oil.potential_reason: Oil leak or excessive oil consumption
solution: Check for any visible oil leaks around the engine, oil filter, and oil pan gasket
Inspect the engine for signs of excessive oil burning (blue smoke from the exhaust)
Top up the engine oil to the correct level
Schedule an appointment for further diagnosis and repair if the issue persists

Oil.issue: Engine oil is dirty or contaminated
Oil.potential_reason: Overdue for an oil change or engine wear
solution: Check the oil change interval recommended by the manufacturer
Drain the old oil and replace the oil filter
Refill with the correct type and quantity of new engine oil
Reset the oil change reminder system, if applicable

Oil.potential_reason: Improper oil selection or mixing of different oil types
solution: Consult the owner's manual or service advisor for the recommended oil type and viscosity
Drain the incorrect oil and replace the oil filter
Refill with the correct type and quantity of new engine oil
Reset the oil change reminder system, if applicable

Tire.potential_reason: Improper tire inflation, misalignment, or suspension issues
solution: Check and adjust the tire pressure to the recommended levels
Inspect the suspension components for wear or damage
Have the vehicle's alignment checked and adjusted if necessary
Replace the tires if the tread depth is below the minimum recommended level

Tire.potential_reason: Road hazards, impact damage, or excessive wear
solution: Inspect the tire for any visible punctures, cuts, or bulges
Assess the extent of the damage and determine if the tire can be repaired or needs replacement
Replace the damaged tire with a new one of the same size, type, and tread pattern
Ensure proper tire inflation and balance after replacement

Tire.potential_reason: Improper tire replacement or mixing of different tire types
solution: Consult the owner's manual or service advisor for the recommended tire sizes and types
Replace all tires with a matching set of the same size, type, and tread pattern
Ensure proper tire inflation and balance after replacement
Consider replacing the tires in axle pairs or as a full set for optimal performance and safety

Brake.issue: Brake pedal feels spongy or goes to the floor
Brake.potential_reason: Air in the brake lines, low brake fluid level, or brake system leak
solution: Check the brake fluid level and top up if necessary
Inspect the brake lines and components for any visible leaks
Bleed the brake system to remove any air from the lines
If the issue persists, further diagnosis and repair may be required

Brake.issue: Excessive brake noise (squealing, grinding, or rubbing)
Brake.potential_reason: Worn brake pads, damaged rotors, or stuck caliper
solution: Inspect the brake pads for wear and replace if necessary
Check the brake rotors for excessive wear, scoring, or warping
Lubricate and clean the caliper slide pins and brackets
If the issue persists, further diagnosis and repair may be required

Brake.potential_reason: Warped or damaged brake rotors, stuck caliper, or suspension issues
solution: Inspect the brake rotors for excessive wear, scoring, or warping
Check the caliper for proper operation and lubrication
Inspect the suspension components for wear or damage
If the issue persists, further diagnosis and repair may be required

Battery.potential_reason: Aged or defective battery, electrical system issues, or parasitic drain
solution: Test the battery's voltage and condition using a battery tester
Check for any loose or corroded battery connections
Inspect the alternator and charging system for proper operation
Identify and eliminate any potential sources of parasitic drain

Battery.potential_reason: Overcharging, physical damage, or extreme temperatures
solution: Inspect the battery for any visible signs of leakage or swelling
Check the charging system for proper voltage regulation
Replace the damaged battery with a new one of the correct size and specifications
Ensure proper battery installation and connections

Battery.potential_reason: Electrolyte leakage, moisture, or improper maintenance
solution: Clean the battery terminals and cable connections using a wire brush or baking soda solution
Apply a thin coating of dielectric grease to the terminals to prevent future corrosion
Ensure proper battery installation and connections
Consider replacing the battery if the corrosion is severe or the battery is old
